title: (x) "Techaid" rounded geometric sans - (similar to) Chickens {Conor}
content:
Can you identify this rounded geometric font ?  
Or is it hand drawing logo ?

Thanks :-)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [testrs5.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015105943/http:/typophile.com/files/testrs5.gif) | 14.02 KB |
author: Vectorian

comments.content:
I'm guessing this was drawn by hand and constructed out of circles - look at the awkward curves in the 'h'. As you suggested, Bryant would be a good alternate, as would Gotham Rounded.

- Lex

Not so good. Widths are odd and 'e' is amateur. I would highly recommend [Bryant Alt](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015105943/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=PRC.123368.0.8&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Techa%C4%B1d&sampleSize=48) (not condensed).

[VAG Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015105943/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/vag-rounded/) is similar and nice too. [T-Mobile](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015105943/http:/www.t-mobile.com/) currently uses it.

Thanks for your quick help :-)  
This logo has the smell of my 70's Childhood, even it's not perfect.

Hope I could use a rounded typo like Bryant for my future works !
I know some quality alternatives have been suggested, but [Chickens](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015105943/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sparkytype/chickens/) is very close.

Conor, I think you've hit it -- all it needs is some stem removal. The shape and proportions of the e and h in particular, are convincing to me.

- Mike Yanega
